Hi Phil, 
 
it means that you aren't logged in to Targetprocess Help Desk with phil@thefoundry.co.uk e-mail. Please log in and then you should be able to download the file. 
 
Yours sincerely,
Slava Volau
Targetprocess Customer Care

Hello Rafal,
 
Thank you for the attached logs. Unfortunately, there is nothing in them, that could shed a light on the performance issues. In order to proceed with troubleshooting, could you please help us with the following information:
1. Describe the way you perform database maintenance. What scripts do you use? How often do you perform it?
2. Are you using any mashups? You can find the list of all installed mashups under Settings - > Mashups. If there are any, please give us the full list. On a side note, please try to load application without mashups. To do so, you should add special "nomashups" parameter to the URL as shown in this screen shot: http://screencast.com/t/IJrvmbgieE Try to work in Targetprocess without mashups for some time. Is there any difference in performance?
3. You have mentioned above, that you started collecting IIS and Performance monitor logs, but in the attached archive I could not find any. Have I missed them?
 
Thank you,
Kate

General.Name: RST server logs for performance analysis

Items.Description:
You can disable the mashup at Settings -> Mashups. You can either uninstall it or temporary disable (in case you decide to turn in back on). To disable you can modify the "placeholder" from  footerplaceholder to something like footerplaceholder_disabled or just tell us to do that.
 
As for the bugs, you are right. sorry for missing that. There is a problem with it and there is no chance you could have set it up, unfortunately. The thing is, when there are different types of cards selected at the view (user stories and bugs, as in your case), we can only filter the properties that these stories and bugs have in common. User Stories does not have "Severity" field, so filter does not work. Please feel free to vote for existing enhancement request at http://tp3.uservoice.com/forums/174654-we-will-rock-you/suggestions/3738345-view-setup-filters-and-visual-encoding-access to increase the priority of the improvement.
 
The only way to use color coding in this case is to create a new view there only bugs are selected. In this case you can use the filters like ?Severity.Importance == 1 or simply ?Severity is 'Critical'
 
Regards,
Sergey.

Hi Patrick,
 
   When you select no Teams in Team\Project context system selects by default "Any Teams",
so you are able to see entities with all Teams assigned.
 
Best regards,
Andrey M.

On Mon, Jan 4, 2016 at 3:13 PM <support@targetprocess.com> wrote:
Hello Edial,
 
It looks like the cards are colored not by the visual encoding feature, but by a mashup called "Board Classes of Services". Before we introduced the visual encoding it was the only way to use color-coding and now it is a bit obsolete. They are a bit different: visual encoding works per view while mashup affects all views, even the ones with visual encoding configured.
So, you could disable the mashup if you are not using it - that should give you more control over how your cards are colored.
 
Please feel free to contact us in case of any questions.
 
Regards,
Sergey.

Hello Edial,
 
It looks like the cards are colored not by the visual encoding feature, but by a mashup called "Board Classes of Services". Before we introduced the visual encoding it was the only way to use color-coding and now it is a bit obsolete. They are a bit different: visual encoding works per view while mashup affects all views, even the ones with visual encoding configured.
So, you could disable the mashup if you are not using it - that should give you more control over how your cards are colored.
 
Please feel free to contact us in case of any questions.
 
Regards,
Sergey.

Changing to you alternate editor (the markup editor) and creating a new story worked. However, I lose the easy of formatting.  Though I didn’t test changing it to the Markup editor and then triggering the API to create the story.  I just created the story manually.  Using the WYSIWYG editor is what breaks when doing it manually.  Using the Markup editor and just pasting the text in plain text (no markup) works and it detects the end of the URL just fine.  So hopefully your developers can just borrow the code that works in the markup editor for when it displays the the saved story and use that in the WYSIWYG editor.

 

 

 

David Lomneck
Resolved in LiveChat

Hello Mike,
 
As I have mentioned in my previous message there are 2 types of uploaded files in Targetprocess: Attachments and images, uploaded through CK Editor: http://screencast.com/t/P2xtzxVS
When you modify Attachment.FileStore.UploadDirectory parameter in web.config - only attachments will be stored in the new location.
To change target folder for CK Editor images we suggest to set up virtual directory in IIS as described below:
 
1. Back-up all images from C:\inetpub\wwwroot\TargetProcess2\wwwroot\upload
2. Delete folder C:\inetpub\wwwroot\TargetProcess2\wwwroot\upload
3. Open IIS and add new Virtual Directory to the Targetprocess application: http://screencast.com/t/oEV3EYDC
4. Specify physical path to the same folder, that you are using in the web.config Attachment.FileStore.UploadDirectory parameter: http://screencast.com/t/QiiQktDKH00k
5. Move all backed up files from C:\inetpub\wwwroot\TargetProcess2\wwwroot\upload\images and C:\inetpub\wwwroot\TargetProcess2\wwwroot\upload\_thumbs to the new folder
6. Try to upload image through CKFinder 
 
Let us know if you have any questions.
 
Best Regards,
Kate
